# Activities

Below are several activities that have been used for classes and events at OSU-MGR.

* Partnering with the [Girl Scouts of Oregon and Southwest Washington](https://www.girlscoutsosw.org/) (GSOSW) OSU-MGR participated in the “STEMapalooza” event in November 2020. [This activity ](http://core-repository.coas.oregonstate.edu/Collection/CoreActivity/GSOSWStemapalooza_OSUMGRActivity_Instructions.pdf)is aimed at K-8th graders, using supplies from home or available at craft stores.
* In April 2019, OSU’s [SMILE ](https://smile.oregonstate.edu/)program participants (middle and high school students from around Oregon) toured the OSU-MGR and participated in hands-on experiments looking at records of tsunamis in marine sediments. [This activity ](http://core-repository.coas.oregonstate.edu/Collection/CoreActivity/TsunamiSand_LabActivity_Peck.pdf)was developed by CEOAS grad student Erin Peck and is aimed at middle and high school and early college students.
* Designed for undergrad students, this [core lab activity](http://core-repository.coas.oregonstate.edu/core-activity) is a virtual lesson that uses cores from the OSU-MGR to explore sediments of the world’s oceans.

### Additional Activities

CEOAS has numerous activities for students to explore earth sciences. View the list [here](https://ceoas.oregonstate.edu/virtual-learning-resources).
